prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Anne Douglas Sedgwick Letters, Accession #8459-b , Special Collections Dept., University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased by the Library from Charles Apfelbaum, Rare Books and Collections, Valley Stream, New York, on September 17, 1986.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In this series of letters Anne Douglas Sedgwick (Anne de Selincourt) writes to Henry Chester Tracy discussing his impending visit; several manuscripts he has given her to read; the illness of her father; stories and books she has read; his visit to Chartres; the writing of several of her books and those of her husband Basil de Selincourt; her declining health; and her life in the English countryside.

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick, Far End, Kingham, Oxon, to Henry Chester Tracy, Long Island, New York 1922 Sep 19
did.physdesc: 4 p. on 1 l., w/ env., ALS

scopecontent.p: She writes after having read his letter and wishing to have him visit.

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy, Oxford Tuesday, 1922 Oct 17
did.physdesc: 4 p. on 1 l., w/ env., ALS

scopecontent.p: Inviting him to lunch and tea on Friday and giving information on train schedules

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy Wednesday, 1922 Oct 18
did.physdesc: 4 p., on 1 l., w/ env., ALS

scopecontent.p: Expressing her pleasure at his plans to visit

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy Monday, 1922 Oct 23
did.physdesc: 4 p. on 1 l., w/ env., ALS

scopecontent.p: After having read "the last batch of mss you left --" and admiring his style, while indicating her inability at expressing things

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy Saturday, 1922 Oct 28
did.physdesc: 4 p. on 1 l., w/ env., ALS

scopecontent.p: Expecting him on "Friday next, the 3rd," and writing how she expresses herself in her books "sheltered behind the personalities of my characters"

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy, Loughton, Essex 1922 Nov 10

scopecontent.p: Saying she thought he was in France, and explaining her delay in writing about his manuscript

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy 1922 Nov 11

scopecontent.p: Sending his letters and manuscripts, asking about his going to Chartres, and apologizing for "a rather rambling note"

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy Wednesday, 1922 Nov 22
did.physdesc: 4 p. on 1 l., w/ env., ALS

scopecontent.p: Mentioning his apparent pleasure in Chartres, Marcel Proust's death, and a volume of Henry James

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy, Hollywood, California 1923 July 25
did.physdesc: 4 p. on 1 l., w/ env, ALS

scopecontent.p: Concerning her "burdened time" with her father and his uncle, expressing her pleasure at the publication of his book and giving news of her husband's publication of collected essays

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy 1924 Sep 12
did.physdesc: 4 p. on 1 l., w/ env., ALS

scopecontent.p: Thanking him for the copy of his book and expressing her delight in seeing it in print, and telling him of a visiting niece

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy, Los Angeles, California 1925 Apr 8

scopecontent.p: Thanking him and his wife, for the charming things they said about her book

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy 1925 Dec 6
did.physdesc: 8 p. on 2 l., w/ env, ALS

scopecontent.p: Telling him that she has written a novel of "sheer self-indulgence and dissipation!" and that she is having one of her short stories sent to him, and inquiring of several general literary topics

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy 1927 June 9
did.physdesc: 3 p. on 1 l., w/ env., ALS

scopecontent.p: Expressing pride at having his book dedicated to her

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy 1927 Nov 18
did.physdesc: 3 p. on 1 l., w/ env., ALS

scopecontent.p: re having an American publisher send him a reprint of "The Religion of the Spirit" and beginning a new novel

did.unittitle: Anne Douglas Sedgwick to Henry Chester Tracy 1929 Sep 19
did.physdesc: 8 p. on 2 l., w/ env., ALS

scopecontent.p: re a review by Mary Ross of her book, [ Dark Hester], and giving some thoughts on this novel
